div.p: This case-insensitive code system http://smart.who.int/ig/smart-immunizations/CodeSystem/IMMZ.I defines the following codes:

tr.td: Location (vaccination location or place) for which the data in the report is being represented
The start date of the reporting period for which data in the report has been included
The end date of the reporting period for which data in the report has been included
Indicates the overall strata or disaggregation which is being represented in the report (e.g. by gender, by region, by age group, etc.)
A disaggregation grouped by the indicator population's sex values
A disaggregation grouped by the indicator population's administrative regions/ areas
A disaggregation grouped by the indicator population's age groups
A disaggregation grouped by the indicator population's dose numbers for a specific vaccine
A disaggregation grouped by the indicator population's vaccine types
A disaggregation grouped by the indicator population's vaccine manufacturers for a specific vaccine
A disaggregation grouped by the indicator population's reaction manifestations for a specific vaccine
A disaggregation grouped by the indicator population's type of reaction for a specific vaccine
A disaggregation grouped by the indicator population's risk and occupational group
The number of doses contained within a vial
The initial quantity of vials in stock at the beginning of a specific reporting period
The quantity of vials in stock at the end of a specific reporting period
The quantity of vials that have been administered to clients, during a specified time frame
The quantity of vials that were opened, during a specific period
The quantity of vials that have been received from external sources, such as suppliers, during a specific period
An adjustment made to the stock level to correct discrepancies between the recorded inventory and the actual physical count. This may be necessary due to errors, theft, or other discrepancies.
The quantity of vials that were not opened and have been wasted or discarded due to expiration or other reasons, during a specific period
Specific reason for the disposal of vaccine
The vaccine is physically damaged or broken, rendering it unsuitable for use.
The vaccine has reached its expiration date and is no longer safe or effective for use.
There has been a malfunction or failure in the cold storage equipment, which has led to the degradation of the vaccine.
The vaccine vial monitor has indicated a change in status, possibly indicating that the vaccines may no longer be viable.
Vaccine has been exposed to freezing temperatures, making it unsuitable for use as freezing can affect the integrity and efficacy of certain immunization products.
